item.title: Hotly-Anticipated Action RPG Crimson Desert Has Finally Gone Gold
item.content:encoded:
Developer and publisher Pearl Abyss has announced that its highly-anticipated open-world action RPG Crimson Desert has gone gold at last, so it's finally safe to start getting excited for that March release date.

In a post on X, the studio thanks Crimson Desert fans (and, presumably, Black Desert fans as well) for their support during the former's development and invites players to stay tuned for further updates on the game.

Pearl Abyss accompanied the announcement of Crimson Desert's completion with a photograph of the game's staff members in a celebratory pose, which is rather endearing (and which rather brings home the fact that the game really is coming out soon).

Just as a reminder, when a game "goes gold", it essentially means that the master copy of the game, i.e. the one from which all other copies will be created, is complete. In essence, it means that the game is ready to ship.

Crimson Desert was first announced all the way back in 2019, with a trailer showing off gameplay for the title appearing at The Game Awards in 2020.

Following that, however, in July 2021, Pearl Abyss delayed Crimson Desert indefinitely, citing the usual need to "create the best possible experience" upon the game's release.

Pearl Abyss continued working on the game in the years that followed, and after one last delay, a release date of March 19th was finally revealed. It now looks as though the studio will be able to keep to this latest release date.

Though Crimson Desert began life as a prequel to Pearl Abyss' Black Desert Online, it eventually morphed into a standalone adventure.

Taking place in the world of Pywel, Crimson Desert features an in-depth combat system with plenty of moves and tactical options to master, as well as a range of other activities including fishing, hunting, and cooking.

You'll be able to play Crimson Desert when it launches on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S on March 19th. Be sure to check out our very own Andrew Otton's preview of the game to see what he thought.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Enshrouded 1.0 Coming to PC and Consoles in Fall as Keen Games Shares Fun Stats
item.content:encoded:
Keen Games has revealed that its survival-crafter Enshrouded will be getting its 1.0 release this fall after two years in Early Access, and what's more, the studio has shared some fun stats to commemorate the game's second anniversary.

In a post on Steam, Keen reveals a new roadmap which confirms that Enshrouded 1.0 is set for release on PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S this fall, but before then, there will be one more major update that will bring Adventure Sharing to the game.

Adventure Sharing will enable players to "share their world with the community", and it'll arrive in version 0.8 of Enshrouded, together with a round of general balance improvements and bug fixes.

When Enshrouded 1.0 does arrive, you can look forward to a host of new features and improvements, including a better new player experience, "greater tactical depth" and "smarter enemy behavior" in combat, and lots of new content, plus more.

In addition to sharing news of Enshrouded 1.0's release window, Keen Games has also revealed some fun stats to commemorate the second anniversary of the game (which is coming up in a couple of days), and players have been pretty busy enjoying the world of Embervale.

In total, Enshrouded players have spent 20,901 years playing the game (collectively, of course), and have destroyed 30 million shroud roots, placed 1.3 billion blocks of water, and farmed 1.3 billion plants.

The world of Enshrouded hasn't been content to rest on its laurels and let all of this happen, though; 420,402 players have drowned in the game, and 52.5 million deaths from fall damage have been registered as well. Be careful out there.

Additionally, Enshrouded has crossed the five million sales mark at last, so it's managed to pick up another million sales for itself since April last year. I'm rooting for you, guys!

Enshrouded is available right now on PC via Steam Early Access, and it's coming to PS5 and Xbox Series X|S this fall. Stay tuned for more.
